On 4/21/10 7:34 AM, Jens Bengtsson wrote:
> Hi!
>
> I want to specify an OnHostsDecideRule and the Crawl Scope documentation says:
>
> "This DecideRule applies the configured decision to any URI that is in one of the hosts of the configured set."
>
> How do I define the configured set?
>
> What do I need besides the following?
>
> <bean class="org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.OnHostsDecideRule">
>            <property name="decision" value="ACCEPT"/>
>   </bean>


OnHostsDecideRule is a specialization of SurtPrefixedDecideRule.

Both these rules can build their internal list of configured prefixes 
(against which URIs are tested) from one or both of:

(1) the crawl's configured seeds -- if setting property 
seedsAsSurtPrefixes is true (which is the default)

(2) a supplied file of URIs or prefixes, one to a line, via the 
'surtsSourceFile' setting property (a path to the file to use)

In addition to the usual ways that desired prefixes are deduced from 
URIs but SurtPrefixedDecideRule, for OnHostsDecideRule all prefixes are 
truncated to the host component.

For example, SurtPrefixedDecideRule will turn the URI 
<http://example.com/images/> into the implied SURT prefix 
<http://(com,example,)/images/>. OnHostsDecideRule will further truncate 
that prefix to <http://(com,example,)/>, causing more URIs to be matched.

Everything OnHostsDecideRule can do, SurtPrefixedDecideRule can do, too 
-- if SurtPrefixedDecideRule is supplied with URIs/prefixes already 
limited to the host-portion. For that reason, OnHostsDecideRule might be 
discouraged/deprecated/deleted someday, so that there aren't redundant 
ways to achieve the same effect.
